metadata.dc:title: Enfuvirtide: first drug of a new family of antiretroviral agents
metadata.dc:description: Enfuvirtide or T-20 is the first drug approved by the FDA andthe EMEA within the group of fusion inhibitors. Its mechanism ofaction is based on the blockade of the entry of the HIV to thebody cells.Enfuvirtide is recommended in combination with other antiretroviraldrugs for the treatment of patients infected by HIV thathave developed resistance or intolerance to other prior antirretroviraltherapies.Clinical trials have shown the effectiveness and safety of thetreatment with this drug. Side effects most commonly reportedare local reactions in the injection siteEnfuvirtide contributes to increase the therapeutic arsenal availablefor the management of the HIV infection, providing rescuetherapy for patients in which prior treatments have failed
